summary: This is a reply brief filed by Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team in support of her motions in limine ahead of her criminal trial. The document argues for the exclusion of various types of evidence, including co-conspirator statements, Rule 404(b) evidence, expert testimony on 'grooming,' and specific exhibits. It also addresses issues like witness identification, the use of the term 'victim,' and evidence related to alleged rape. The filing reveals procedural disputes and the defense's strategy to limit the scope of the government's case.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case, filing motions to exclude evidence. Her defense attorneys are arguing on her behalf.

persons.name: Jeffrey S. Pagliuca
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, signed the reply brief.

persons.name: Laura A. Menninger
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, listed on the filing.

persons.name: Christian R. Everdell
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell from Cohen & Gresser LLP, listed on the filing.

persons.name: Bobbi C. Sternheim
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, listed on the filing.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased financier; the alleged co-conspirator for whom Maxwell is accused of recruiting and grooming minors.

connections.description: Maxwell is alleged to have conspired with Epstein to recruit, groom, and traffic minors for sexual abuse.
Pagliuca is one of Maxwell's defense attorneys filing motions on her behalf.
Menninger is one of Maxwell's defense attorneys.

events.title: Court Order on Co-conspirator Disclosure
events.description: The court ordered the government to disclose identities of unnamed co-conspirators and all co-conspirator hearsay statements it intends to offer at trial by October 11, 2021.

events.title: Government's Disclosure Deadline
events.description: Deadline for the government to provide Rule 404(b) notice and disclose co-conspirator information per the court's September 3 order.

events.title: Filing of Maxwell's Reply Brief
events.description: Maxwell's defense team files this reply in support of her motions in limine.

events.title: Search of El Brillo Way
events.description: Law enforcement search of Epstein's Palm Beach property, resulting in seizure of evidence.

events.title: Sting Operation and Seizure of Exhibit
events.description: An undercover sting operation leads to the seizure of what would become Government Exhibit 52.

keyFacts: The defense argues the government failed to comply with a court order to disclose co-conspirator statements and proper Rule 404(b) notice.
Maxwell's team seeks to exclude expert testimony on 'grooming,' arguing it is unreliable and not based on scientific principles.
The defense contends that evidence related to an alleged victim who was over the age of consent in the relevant jurisdictions is not direct evidence of the charged conspiracies and is inadmissible.
The government has conceded it will not offer evidence of Maxwell's alleged 'flight' or her alleged false statements from 2016 depositions.
The defense requests a pre-trial hearing to suppress an eyewitness identification they claim was unduly suggestive.
